attributes.action: Protect Self-employed salary during the COVID-19 pandemic using pay through HMRC
attributes.additional_details: The government has provided relief for some companies, provided that they operate from a rateable business property, this does not cover a large percentage of self employed who have a history of tax contributions through their business but are currently being left at the mercy of the UC system regardless of their filing history.
attributes.background: Currently government position is that self-employed workers are entitled to UC equating to less than £100 per week, regardless of their salary or tax history. This petition is to ask that all self-employed have their salaries protected in line with their tax filing history through HMRC.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action.

Pay self employed workers a wage due to lack or earnings caused by COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303345

Provide COVID19 income support for the newly self-employed, without HMRC records: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310471

Remove the £50k earnings limit for self-employed to access government funding: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310455

Coronavirus Support Package for Directors / Shareholders of small Limited Co's: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310515

Get HMRC to refund the Self-Employed their Jan 2020 1st Tax Payment on Account: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304995

Bring forward COVID-19 Self-employment grants to April 2020: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310898

You can find out about what Government support is available for people as a result of coronavirus (under the section on employment and financial support) here: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus


You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
